text:
I'd like the ability to plug in XStream so it is used for serialization instead
of the default mechanism. Furthermore, when this is done, the web container
should not require classes to implement Serializable because XStream has no such
requirement.

The focus here is on ease of development. See http://xstream.codehaus.org/ for
more information.
creator: cowwoc@bbs.darktech.org
remm@apache.org
text:
While you are free to implement your own session manager, I am against this
feature being integrated in Tomcat. Sorry.

Are there any concerns that must be handled within Tomcat to make this work?
That is, will Tomcat complain when I try to persist non-serializable objects or
will it delegate to the session manager implementation to make such a call?

Also, can you point me to documentation on the session manager (hopefully you
have something on how to write your own and plug it into Tomcat)?
creator: cowwoc@bbs.darktech.org
